result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah J Kropp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Micheal Zell; Defendant appears in person and by Attorney Jessica Phelps and Attorney Emily Nolan-Plutchak; Attorney Zell makes statement to the court in regards to the information used to obtain restitution amount; Attorney Phelps makes statement opposing specific charges; FCC Kruse orders restitution in the amount of $3,753.41. FTR minutes 09:01:39 thru 09:10:00 am
Restitution hearing on April 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Noah J Kropp in court with attorney Emily Nolan Pluchak   Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Plutchak argues her request regarding being placed on the sex registry.  Atty. Zell argues against the request. 10:31 Court adjourns sentencing for later this morning.
11:43.  Court reconvenes.  Court does not issue registry.
Sentencing hearing on March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

1:08 Defendant Noah J Kropp in court with attorney Jessica Shank Phelps.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Phelps asks that bond be amended to incidental contact with minor females so that Kropp can attend school.  Atty Zell makes a clarification and does not object as long as it is clear that it is incidental in the school building.  Court modifies the bond.
No contact with REH or residence or any incidental contact with minor females.  Incidental contact with minor females inside the school building only.
